comments:
Creating a new web service causes exception.

Here's what I think is happening. 

It happens when you do File > New > Web Service without any Javabean selected in the explorer, and hit finish on the first screen. The second page of the wizard allows you to specify the Javabean to expose as a web service, but since nothing was selected in the Explorer that box is empty. It should either warn you in a nice way or disable the Finish button if it doesn't have a javabean selected.

WTP's web service model has you create your standard Javabean class first, then go through this wizard after it's created to gen all the Axis artifacts. So to make this work just create the javabean class first. Once I did that I was able to get all way through the wizard, and successfully test it with their Web Service Explorer.


Repro
-------------
1/ Create new dynamic web project 
2/ Create new package 'com.bug.repro'
3/ Right click new package New --> Other --> Web Services --> Web Service
4/ Select Web Service then hit "next" button
4/ Brings up Web Service Dialog, hit "finish" causes the error. See below
5/ Try it again and you have to hit next twice before it will move foward in the dialog. 


IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

Adrian, I think you're spot on with your analysis. The problem has been fixed in WTP 1.5. Pages 1 thru 3 from WTP 1.0.x have been converged into a single page which includes a "Service implementation" entry field (and browse button) for selection the artifact to begin with, and disables the page's "finish" and "next" buttons when the selection is blank.
